marketNews.title: Other hot topics to know
marketNews.content:
1. Director of the Indonesia Stock Exchange, Irvan Susandy, said on Monday (5/5) that the exchange will soon implement the opening of broker codes and domicile, although details were not provided. He explained that the opening will not be real-time; data will be sent after the break following the first trading session. The initiative is still under development due to changes in the exchange's system.
2. A residential property price survey by Bank Indonesia showed that residential property price growth slowed to +1.07% YoY in 1Q25 (vs. +1.89% YoY in 1Q24 and +1.39% YoY in 4Q24), marking the weakest growth since 3Q21. Meanwhile, residential property sales in 1Q25 grew +0.73% YoY (vs. +31.16% YoY in 1Q24 and -15.09% YoY in 4Q24), supported by a +21.75% YoY increase in sales of small-type houses (vs. +37.84% YoY in 1Q24 and -23.7% YoY in 4Q24) amid a contraction in medium-type house sales of -35.76% YoY (vs. +13.57% YoY in 1Q24 and -16.61% YoY in 4Q24) and large-type house sales of -11.69% YoY (vs. +48.51% YoY in 1Q24 and +20.44% YoY in 4Q24).
3. Bloomberg reported that BPI Danantara and Eramet SA are in talks to form a partnership to acquire the HPAL smelter owned by Zhejiang Huayou Cobalt Co. in Weda Bay Industrial Park. If completed, it would be the first major transaction since BPI Danantara was established. Sources said a memorandum of understanding could be signed by the end of May 2025, but discussions are ongoing and plans may change.
4. Bloomberg reported that electric-vehicle battery maker Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. (CATL) is seeking a loan of about 1 billion US dollars to finance its investment in Indonesia. The funds would be used to finance a joint-venture with Indonesia Battery Corporation to build a battery-cell plant in Karawang, West Java.
5. The Chairman of the Indonesian Gas Users Industry Forum, Yustinus Gunawan, said on Monday (5/5) that gas supply realization was far below the allocated incentive price for certain natural gas (HGBT), with only 54% realized in January 2025. Excess usage will be charged a regasification tariff of 16.77 US dollars per MMBtu. He also noted that the excess payment in January 2025 has not been compensated by Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS) or other gas distributors. Specific industrial gas allocation (AGIT) reached 73% in February 2025 and 76% in March 2025.
6. President Prabowo Subianto said on Monday (5/5) that he will meet Bill Gates on Wednesday (7/5), claiming Gates offered support for social programs in Indonesia. Prabowo said he does not yet know the form of assistance but reiterated that his administration will continue to focus on free nutritious-meal programs.
7. The Director of APBN Preparation at the Ministry of Finance, Rofyanto Kurniawan, said on Monday (5/5) that the government will allocate 268 trillion rupiah for the free nutritious-meal program in 2026, an increase of about 57% YoY from the 2025 allocation of 171 trillion rupiah. After reaching the 2025 target of 82.9 million beneficiaries, the focus will shift to improving program quality. The program is expected to contribute 1.03% to 2026 GDP, create more than 1.32 million jobs, and help reduce poverty by 0.38 percentage points.

tickerNews.title: EXCL reports Q1 2025 net profit down 29% YoY, below expectations
tickerNews.content:
XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera ($EXCL) has announced financial performance for 1Q25 – which is the performance of XL Axiata before merger with Smartfren Telecom – with net profit of 385 billion rupiah (-29% YoY, -23% QoQ). This result is below expectations (17% of the 2025F consensus estimate).

Customer count up, ARPU down

Operationally, EXCL recorded mobile subscriber base of 58.9 million in 1Q25 (+2.3% YoY, +0.2% QoQ), with average revenue per user (ARPU) falling to 40 thousand rupiah (-9% YoY, -2% QoQ).

Management said in earnings call on Tuesday (6/5) that excluding revenue from fixed broadband business (First Media) which will be reflected in financial statements at end of 2024, the company's revenue actually fell -5% YoY in 1Q25.

Management explained that ARPU decline in 1Q25 was caused by weakening purchasing power and tighter competition as rivals offered cheaper starter packages. Nevertheless, management sees competition intensity among operators easing and expected to reflect positively in 2H25.

Merger completed, operational integration continues

Following the merger that was completed on 16 April 2025, EXCL management is still in operational integration phase and cannot provide guidance for 2025. However, management expects merger cost synergy of 100 million US dollars this year. Management also anticipates a slight increase in expenses and capex at the early integration stage, before expected to decline in the long term.

Key Takeaway

In earnings calls of Telkom Indonesia ($TLKM), Indosat ($ISAT), and EXCL, each management said competition intensity among operators is easing and expected to reflect positively in 2H25. We assess the potential easing based on ARPU decline trend, where TLKM continues to fall near psychological level of 40 thousand rupiah (1Q25: 42.4 thousand rupiah, 4Q24: 44 thousand rupiah) and EXCL has reached 40 thousand rupiah. Additionally, continuous decline in data yield will damage profitability of all industry players.

For EXCL, the 2Q25 performance release will become a new base for the merged entity, so future performance will be evaluated using that figure.

tickerNews.title: HRTA reports net profit of 150 billion rupiah in 1Q25, up 46% YoY
tickerNews.content: $HRTA: Hartadinata Abadi recorded net profit of 150 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (+6.8% QoQ, +46% YoY), in line with guidance 2025 targeting growth around +40-50% YoY. Quarterly profit increase driven by revenue up +38% QoQ. However, higher cost of goods sold (+39% QoQ) and operating expenses (+78% QoQ) caused operating margin to fall by 120 basis points QoQ to 4.1%.

tickerNews.title: MIDI aims for high-single-digit revenue growth in 2025, allocates 1.5 trillion capex
tickerNews.content: $MIDI: Management said in 1Q25 earnings call on Tuesday (6/5) that the company targets minimum high-single-digit revenue growth during 2025 (vs. 2024 actual +15% YoY), with SSSG target minimum mid-single-digit (vs. 2024 +9.86% YoY). To achieve, MIDI allocates capex of 1.5 trillion rupiah in 2025 (same as 2024). Funds for opening 200 new stores in 2025 (vs. 203 in 2024) focusing outside Java, and relocation of one operational warehouse in June 2025. Management also mentioned dividend payout ratio for FY2024 will be higher than FY2023 which reached 30%, implying minimum dividend FY2024 of 4.92 rupiah per share with dividend yield 1.2% as of Tuesday (6/5).

tickerNews.title: MTLA reports marketing sales of 500 billion rupiah in 1Q25, up 14.2% YoY
tickerNews.content: $MTLA: Director Olivia Surodjo said the company recorded marketing sales of 500 billion rupiah during 1Q25 (+14.2% YoY), equal to 25% of the 2025 target of 2 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: SKRN announces FY2024 dividend of ~285 billion rupiah, 40 rupiah per share
tickerNews.content: $SKRN: Superkrane Mitra Utama will distribute FY2024 dividend of approximately 285 billion rupiah or 40 rupiah per share, corresponding to about 129% dividend payout ratio and indicating dividend yield 8.6% as of Tuesday (6/5). Cum date on regular market and negotiation on 14 May 2025, payment on 28 May 2025.

tickerNews.title: RAJA declares FY2024 dividend of ~254 billion rupiah, 60 rupiah per share
tickerNews.content: $RAJA: Rukun Raharja will distribute FY2024 dividend of about 254 billion rupiah or 60 rupiah per share, corresponding to about 59% dividend payout ratio and indicating dividend yield 2.7% as of Tuesday (6/5). Cum date on regular market and negotiation on 9 May 2025, payment on 4 June 2025.

tickerNews.title: KKGI insider Leong See Mun sells ~12.1 million shares for ~4.5 billion rupiah
tickerNews.content: $KKGI: Commissioner Leong See Mun sold approximately 12.1 million KKGI shares at an average price of about 375 rupiah per share on May 2-5 2025. Total transaction value about 4.5 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Leong's ownership fell from 0.53% to 0.28%.

tickerNews.title: GIAA reports 15 aircraft awaiting heavy maintenance, citing global supply-chain crisis
tickerNews.content: $GIAA: Director Rahmat Hanafi told Kontan on Tuesday (6/5) that currently 15 aircraft are awaiting routine heavy maintenance, consisting of 14 Citilink aircraft and 1 GIAA aircraft. Bloomberg earlier reported that GIAA had halted operations of at least 15 aircraft due to payment difficulties for maintenance. Rahmat claimed the issue is caused by the global supply-chain crisis for aircraft parts.

tickerNews.title: BLES targets double-digit revenue growth in 2025 with new plant expansion
tickerNews.content: $BLES: Director Andrew said the company targets double-digit revenue growth in 2025. To support this, the company will operate a new plant in Banjarnegara, Central Java mid-year. This expansion will increase total light-brick production capacity from 4.61 million cubic meters per year to 5.6 million cubic meters per year.

tickerNews.title: MCAS sees Bank of Singapore increase stake to 9.47% from 6.49%
tickerNews.content: $MCAS: M Cash Integrasi announced that Bank of Singapore added 25.8 million MCAS shares. Transaction price and date not disclosed; recorded in KSEI data as of 2 May 2025. After the transaction, Bank of Singapore's ownership rose from 6.49% to 9.47%.

tickerNews.title: MTWI shares sold by BPII, reducing stake to 85.9%
tickerNews.content: $MTWI: Shareholder Malacca Trust Wuwungan Insurance, Batavia Prosperindo Internasional (BPII) sold about 28.4 million MTWI shares at an average price of 137.5 rupiah per share. Total transaction about 3.9 billion rupiah. After the transaction, BPII's ownership fell from 86.86% to 85.9%.

tickerNews.title: VKTR wins tender for 80 electric buses from Transjakarta
tickerNews.content: $VKTR: VKTR Technology Mobility won a tender to supply 80 locally assembled (CKD) electric buses to PT Transportasi Jakarta (Transjakarta), transaction value not disclosed. With this order, VKTR has supplied 152 electric buses in the Transjakarta network.
